alert.note: Alert for Southwest Elko County (Nevada) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued September 03 at 12:11PM PDT by NWS Elko
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southwestern Elko and north central Eureka Counties through 1245 PM PDT... At 1211 PM PDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Emigrant Pass, moving northeast at 30 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Heavy rainfall along with gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Carlin, Palisade, Emigrant Pass, and South Area Mine. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
